title: Barnwell picks apart three wild Week 2 endings, from the Cowboys' big kick to the Jaguars' collapse
content: Bill Barnwell sorts through fourth-quarter fireworks in Giants-Cowboys, Broncos-Colts and Jaguars-Bengals.

title: Sources: Burrow needs toe surgery, out 3 months
content: Bengals QB Joe Burrow will need toe surgery that will sideline him a minimum of three months, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Eagles quiet Chiefs' talk with scoreboard statement
content: The Eagles got the final word during a hotly contested Super Bowl rematch with the Chiefs on Sunday that was intense to the very end.

title: LSU lands coveted QB recruit to kick off '27 class
content: Peyton Houston, the top-ranked pocket passer in the ESPN Junior 300 for 2027, has committed to LSU, becoming the first member of the Tigers' 2027 recruiting class.

title: McCarthy's second start a slog as Falcons soar
content: A week after authoring fourth-quarter heroics in a rousing Minnesota victory, Vikings quarterback J.J. McCarthy and the rest of the offense slogged through 60 mostly rough minutes in a 22-6 loss to the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday night at U.S. Bank Stadium.

title: Jets to prep QB Taylor to start in case Fields out
content: With quarterback Justin Fields in the NFL's concussion protocol, the Jets are preparing for the possibility of starting Tyrod Taylor against the Buccaneers.

title: Cowboys sign Clowney to boost depth, says Jones
content: The Cowboys have signed three-time Pro Bowl edge rusher Jadeveon Clowney to a contract, owner Jerry Jones said after the team's overtime win against the Giants on Sunday.

title: Spain's prime minister calls for Israel sports ban
content: Spain's prime minister called for Israel to be banned from international sporting events after pro-Palestinian activists disrupted the Spanish Vuelta cycling race.

title: Reign-Racing game halted after DeMelo collapses
content: The Seattle Reign and Racing Louisville abandoned their match in the National Women's Soccer League on Sunday night after a medical emergency involving Racing midfielder Savannah DeMelo.

title: Joe Burrow out with turf toe: What is it, and what will 3 months away mean for the QB, Bengals?
content: Jake Browning helped deliver a win to the Bengals on Sunday, but what's reasonable to expect from the backup?

title: 'They have the most complete team': MLB insiders weigh in on October's teams to beat
content: In a year with no 100-game winners atop the standings, here's who those around the sport think could make a deep postseason run.

title: Why Geno Smith is settling in for the long haul in Las Vegas
content: Geno Smith spent seven years in Seattle and says he never felt fully comfortable with what he always felt was Russell Wilson's team.

title: 'What's your deal?': Jim Harbaugh-Pete Carroll rivalry timeline
content: The Chargers-Raiders "Monday Night Football" matchup marks a renewal of a beef almost two decades long.

title: From dormant to dominant: Why Dominique Malonga could save the Storm
content: The Storm knew all along Dominique Malonga would emerge as a key part of their WNBA title hopes -- whether it's this year or in years to come.

title: Liberty, Lynx, Aces, Dream start with wins
content: The Lynx, Aces, Dream and Liberty each lead their series 1-0. Here's how they did it, and how New York won in the desert.

title: Pickups: Daniel Jones among top options to replace Joe Burrow
content: Highlighting available QBs for those who roster Burrow, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 3.

title: Buzz: Hunter plays both ways, Judkins debuts, Burrow injury and more from Sunday
content: Travis Hunter was pressed into extra DB service, the Bengals win with Jake Browning and more Sunday takeaways

title: How Karina Tovar, the NFL's first Latina ref, became a trailblazer
content: To kick off Hispanic Heritage Month, the daughter of Mexican immigrants discussed how her love of football turned into a pioneering journey.

title: Week 3 takeaways: Texas A&M's off to a hot start; UCLA ... not so much
content: After exciting wins and disappointing losses, we take a look at the biggest storylines following Week 3.

title: Wrestlepalooza 2025: Date, time, channel, card, how to watch
content: ESPN is excited to present the first annual Wrestlepalooza on Saturday. Check out how to watch John Cena, Seth Rollins and other WWE stars.

title: Philadelphia's virtual jabs at Kansas City lead NFL Week 2 trolls
content: The San Francisco 49ers also made sure to poke fun at the New Orleans Saints after winning on the road, leading Week 2's NFL trolls.

title: Inside the Warriors' stalemate with Jonathan Kuminga
content: Kuminga's future with the Warriors will determine how the team fills its remaining roster spots as training camp nears.

title: Champions League storylines: Will Arsenal win it all, PSG repeat, Barca rebound?
content: The UEFA Champions League kicks into high gear on Tuesday. But who are the favorites? How about the fashionable outsiders? Mark Ogden weighs in on the big clubs and talking points.

title: Man City's big men step up vs. Man United, lucky Liverpool, Madrid's ref déjà vu, more
content: Man City's "big men" came up big in Sunday's derby win, Liverpool get lucky (again) and Real Madrid have more complaints about the referees in LaLiga, as Gab Marcotti explains the weekend.

title: Betting buzz: Derrick Henry stiff-arms betting public
content: It was a popular bet for Derrick Henry to score a touchdown on Sunday, but Baltimore's star RB failed to do so.

title: MLS: Did Müller, Vancouver just leapfrog the league's best?
content: Thomas Müller and Vancouver trounced Philly 7-0, so was it enough to dethrone the leaders of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Salah free transfer
content: Real Madrid are considering a move for Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah in 2027. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'I will not go anywhere': Why Nitish is pledging loyalty to NDA, again & again
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, attempting to solidify his commitment to the NDA, publicly affirmed his allegiance in the presence of PM Modi, addressing his past political shifts and blaming his party members for switching sides.

title: SC on Waqf Act: What top court stayed, what’s in force — All you need to know
content: The Supreme Court has addressed the Waqf (Amendment) Act. The court upheld the law's constitutionality. However, some key provisions are now on hold. These include rules about who can create Waqf. Also stayed is the process for designating property. The Central Waqf Council must limit non-Muslim members. The court seeks to balance interests while the law is reviewed.

title: 'India coming to table': Navarro's odd remark as US official flies to Delhi for trade talks
content: Amidst ongoing trade deal discussions, US President Donald Trump's advisor Peter Navarro criticized India's high tariffs and Russian oil purchases, alleging it funds Russia's war efforts. Despite these tensions, a US trade negotiator is in India for preliminary talks, aiming to revive the suspended bilateral trade agreement negotiations.

title: 'Hellbent on insulting Bihar': PM Modi attacks Congress over 'bidi' post
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi strongly criticized the Congress-RJD alliance, citing a controversial social media post by Kerala Congress that compared Bihar to a bidi. Modi accused the opposition of insulting Bihar and vowed to stop infiltration allegedly encouraged by them.

title: 'Jalebi Baby' Pakistan anthem blunder; artist Tesher says 'shout out to the sound guy'
content: The Asia Cup 2025 match between India and Pakistan faced an unusual start with 'Jalebi Baby' mistakenly played instead of Pakistan's anthem, prompting a complaint from the PCB. India secured a dominant seven-wicket victory, chasing down Pakistan's 128-run target, led by Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 47. Kuldeep Yadav's stellar bowling earned him Player of the Match for the second consecutive game.

title: iOS 26 roll out today: List of supported iPhones; how to download
content: Apple's 2025 event unveiled the iPhone 17 series and iPhone Air, with iOS 26 launching publicly on September 15th. The update will be available for iPhones as old as iPhone 11 and SE (2nd gen). New features include a Liquid Glass interface, smarter Siri, redesigned Photos app, and iPhone Mirroring on Mac. Select models will support Apple Intelligence features.

title: Abhishek Sharma posts two-word message after going after Shaheen Afridi
content: In the Asia Cup 2025 clash, Kuldeep Yadav's bowling and Jasprit Bumrah's contribution restricted Pakistan to a modest total. Abhishek Sharma then ignited India's chase with a rapidfire innings, smashing Shaheen Afridi for boundaries and sixes. His quickfire 31 set the stage for India's comfortable seven-wicket victory, prompting a patriotic message from the young opener.

title: ITR filing due date today: Tax department shares quick guide
content: The Income Tax Department advises taxpayers facing e-filing portal access issues to address local browser or device settings. Simple steps like clearing cache, using supported browsers, and disabling extensions can resolve common problems. With over 7 crore ITRs filed as the September 15 deadline approaches, the department denies any extension despite user complaints about glitches.

title: ‘We will do better’: Microsoft CEO acknowledges ‘lack of empathy’; meets with staff
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella acknowledged the need to rebuild trust with employees following layoffs and a return-to-office mandate. He addressed concerns about a perceived lack of empathy and the challenges of remote work, particularly for new hires. Nadella also cautioned staff about future business challenges and the need for renewal.

title: 'Leader sitting with us': Nitish goes off script; 'reveals' what led to JD(U)-BJP split
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar attributed his 2022 split from the BJP to internal dissent within his own party, the JD(U), during a rally in Purnea. He pledged unwavering future alliance with the BJP, despite past coalition fluctuations. Nitish's remarks spotlighted Lallan Singh, hinting at his role in the earlier discord.

title: 'I will have to do all the talking': Trump on Ukraine-Russia peace deal
content: Donald Trump stated that a face-to-face meeting between Zelenskyy and Putin is unlikely due to intense personal animosity. He expressed his intention to personally intervene, highlighting the difficulty in resolving the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Despite diplomatic efforts and prisoner exchanges, Moscow continues its offensive, while Ukraine rejects territorial concessions, leading to ongoing challenges in achieving peace.

title: Grand Swiss: Dutch no. 1 Anish Giri wins title; Candidates 2026 spot sealed
content: Anish Giri and Matthias Bluebaum secured their spots in the FIDE Candidates Tournament 2026 after a strong showing at the FIDE Grand Swiss. R Vaishali defended her title in the women's event, marking her second appearance in the Women’s Candidates Tournament 2026. With Caruana and Nakamura also confirmed, the Candidates Tournament is set to be highly competitive.

title: Gemini Nano Banana AI Saree: What it this new trend; how you can create photos
content: Following the Nano Banana AI 3D figurine craze, the 'Banana AI Saree' trend has emerged on Instagram. Users are transforming selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits using Google’s Gemini Nano Banana image editing tool. The AI crafts images with chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, mimicking classic Bollywood aesthetics with popular styles like polka-dot and floral sarees.

title: Explained: How private candidates can take additional subjects in CBSE exams
content: CBSE has clarified the eligibility rules for private candidates taking additional subjects in Classes 10 and 12. Only students previously studying the subject and placed in 'Compartment' or 'Essential Repeat' categories are eligible. Stringent requirements include a two-year study period, minimum 75% attendance, and completion of internal assessments to maintain academic standards.

title: TikTok's return: Video app will switch to US-controlled ownership
content: Americans may continue using TikTok. A framework deal transfers TikTok's ownership to US control. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced this after US-China trade talks in Spain. Trump and Chinese Premier Xi Jinping may finalize the agreement soon. The deal addresses national security concerns. TikTok's popularity soared during Covid-19 lockdowns. US officials worried about ByteDance's Chinese origins.

title: New IRCTC train ticket rules: From Oct 1, Aadhaar authentication must; what it means
content: Starting October 1, 2025, Indian Railways will mandate Aadhaar authentication for booking reserved general tickets via IRCTC during the first 15 minutes of reservation opening.

title: India vs Pakistan controversy: Why handshakes matter in cricket — rules and protocols explained
content: Tensions flared between the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) and India after the Asia Cup match, with the PCB demanding the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft. This demand follows Indian players' refusal to shake hands with their Pakistani counterparts, a gesture made in solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 'Gone very well': Trump hails US-China trade talks; will speak to Xi soon
content: President Trump hinted at a potential breakthrough regarding TikTok's future as US-China trade talks progressed in Madrid. He suggested a deal was reached for the popular app, pleasing young users, while also mentioning upcoming discussions with President Xi. These developments occurred amidst ongoing trade negotiations, with both countries seeking to resolve economic and trade disputes, including the TikTok issue.

title: Gaza war: Rubio meets Netanyahu; Qatar levels serious charge against Israel
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio affirmed support for Qatar's Gaza mediation after Israeli strikes, despite prior criticism from Rubio and President Trump. Netanyahu defended the strikes targeting Hamas, comparing them to post-9/11 US actions against terrorists. He asserted that harboring terrorists negates sovereignty.

title: Historic! Vaishali wins Women's Grand Swiss; now 3rd Indian to enter Candidates
content: R Vaishali defended her FIDE Women’s Grand Swiss title in 2025, securing a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament. She finished with 8 points after drawing against Tan Zhongyi. Vaishali joins Koneru Humpy and Divya Deshmukh as the third Indian woman to qualify for the Candidates, marking a significant achievement for Indian women's chess.

title: Savannah James: LeBron’s wife goes viral — quirky video sparks buzz
content: Savannah James recently shared personal facts in a "Get Unready With Me" video, revealing details about her dream car and skincare routine. Meanwhile, LeBron James celebrated their wedding anniversary with a heartfelt Instagram message and a romantic dance clip. The couple, together for over two decades, marked another milestone in their enduring love story.

title: Pope Leo slams Elon Musk: Vatican finances under scrutiny, how much is the Pontiff paid??
content: Pope Leo has criticised the vast disparity between CEO and worker pay, citing Elon Musk's compensation. The Vatican's wealth, accumulated over centuries through property, donations, and investments, includes over 5,400 properties valued at €2.6 billion. While the Pope earns a substantial salary, the Vatican faces financial challenges, including a reported deficit that led to salary cuts for cardinals. Read below!

title: Trade deal soon? US chief negotiator to land in India tonight; talks begin tomorrow
content: Amidst signs of easing trade tensions, the US chief negotiator is set to arrive in India tonight, paving the way for renewed trade discussions starting tomorrow. This visit follows recent social media exchanges between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump, indicating a potential thaw in relations previously strained by US tariffs on Indian imports, particularly concerning Russian oil purchases.

title: Handshake row takes ugly turn: Pak threaten to withdraw from Asia Cup
content: Tensions escalate at the Asia Cup as Pakistan threaten withdrawal if match referee Andy Pycroft isn't removed. The PCB formally complained to the ICC, alleging Code of Conduct violations after a handshake controversy during the India-Pakistan match. Pakistan alleges Pycroft instructed their captain to avoid shaking hands, and expressed disappointment at India's post-match behavior.

title: Why Musk cannot pull a 'Trump' in the UK; even with Mr Robinson
content: ​This is the backdrop Elon Musk has parachuted into, with the grace of a meme lord and the menace of a billionaire arsonist. He has found Britain’s sorest nerve—immigration—and jabbed it with the same glee he once reserved for short-sellers. Grooming gangs, free speech, Tommy Robinson: Musk has taken Britain’s ugliest domestic quarrels and broadcast them to the world, not because he loves Britain, but because chaos is his native language.

title: No more paper! Oman residents can now use digital copies of their national IDs
content: The Royal Oman Police now legally recognize certified electronic versions of national ID cards and driver’s licenses across Oman. Accessible via the official website, these digital documents hold the same legal status as physical copies. This change, alongside new flexible expat residence cards and extended validity for Omani IDs, reflects Oman’s ongoing commitment to digital transformation and streamlined public services.

title: Emmanuel Acho backlash: Charlie Kirk remarks spark row — Joe Burrow acts
content: Emmanuel Acho is under fire for spreading inaccurate claims about Charlie Kirk in viral TikTok and YouTube videos, refusing to correct them even after backlash. At the same time, the Joe Burrow Foundation cut ties with Hamilton County Judge Ted Berry, removing him from its board over remarks following Kirk’s assassination at Utah Valley University.

title: 'Infiltrators have to go': PM targets Cong, RJD; hails role of 'mothers & sisters'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched a strong critique against the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) and Congress in Purnea, Bihar, ahead of the upcoming assembly elections. He accused the opposition of supporting infiltrators, endangering Bihar's resources and security.

title: Kelce vs Reynolds: Swift's team denies link — Blake Lively lawsuit twist
content: Taylor Swift's legal team asserted she has no involvement in the lawsuit between Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni concerning his film, *It Ends With Us*. A judge denied Baldoni's request to question Swift, reinforcing her lack of connection to the case. Amidst the legal turmoil, Travis Kelce has reportedly supported Swift, even unfollowing Ryan Reynolds on social media.

title: Flashflood in J&K: Cloudburst sparks panic, mudslides block roads; no casualties
content: A cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Reasi district caused flash floods, creating panic among residents, though no casualties were reported. Heavy rains continue to plague North India, leading to floods, transportation disruptions, and school closures. Recent cloudbursts, landslides, and flash floods have resulted in numerous fatalities and injuries across the region, prompting authorities to issue warnings and suspend pilgrimages.

title: 'Amounts to theft': Russia furious over frozen assets; warns EU states
content: Russia has issued a warning. It says it will target any European nation that tries to seize its assets. This follows reports that the European Union is exploring ways to use frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine. Russia considers any seizure of its assets as theft.

title: Elon Musk buys Tesla shares worth $1 billion! Stock surges in pre-market trading
content: Elon Musk bought Tesla shares worth $1 billion. This purchase occurred through a trust. Tesla shares saw a jump before trading began. This follows Tesla's proposal for Musk's pay package. Shareholders will vote on this package in November. The package could grant Musk shares based on performance. Tesla has faced challenges this year. The shareholder vote will decide Musk's compensation.

title: CBSE tightens board exam rules: 75% attendance; 2-year study now mandatory
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education strengthens rules for class 10 and 12 exams. Students now need 75% attendance. Internal assessments are compulsory. Class 10 and 12 are two-year programs. No shortcuts are allowed. These changes align with the National Education Policy 2020. Schools must follow rules or face action. The board focuses on discipline and complete learning.

title: UAE national day: Public holiday dates out, will residents get long weekend?
content: The UAE has confirmed December 2 and 3 as public holidays for National Day 2025, marking the country’s 54th anniversary. Residents are awaiting a decision on December 1, which could turn the break into a long weekend. Major celebrations are planned across all emirates, including fireworks, concerts, cultural events, and a central ceremony at a yet-to-be-announced venue.

title: What India’s data engineering boom really looks like in 2025
content: India’s data engineering boom in 2025 is driving the backbone of the digital economy. With market size projected to exceed USD 42 billion, demand for skilled engineers outpaces supply, pushing salaries higher. Banking, e-commerce, and healthcare lead recruitment, while Python, cloud, and database expertise dominate the skills landscape. Attrition challenges persist, but opportunities remain transformative.

title: BMW rams bike: Driver arrested; victim was taken to kin's hospital 22km away
content: Gaganpreet Kaur was arrested for allegedly driving the BMW that caused the death of finance ministry officer Navjot Singh in Dhaula Kuan. Singh's wife, Sandeep, injured in the crash, accused Kaur of delaying proper medical care, opting for a distant hospital linked to her relatives.

title: Travis Kelce: Chiefs’ star slips again — elite status in question
content: The Kansas City Chiefs are off to a concerning 0-2 start, with Travis Kelce's recent struggles under scrutiny. Critical errors in crucial moments, including a costly interception against the Eagles, have raised questions about his reliability and role. As Kelce's performance declines, the Chiefs face a pivotal decision on how to recalibrate their offense and develop alternative playmakers.

title: New drama in handshake row: PCB lodges complaint; demands removal
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board has formally complained to the ICC regarding missing handshakes during the Asia Cup clash with India, demanding the removal of the Match Referee. The PCB alleges violations of the ICC Code of Conduct and MCC Laws, claiming the referee instructed their captain to avoid shaking hands.

title: Nepal's interim govt: PM Karki unveils cabinet; Ghising made minister
content: Following violent demonstrations sparked by a social media ban and fueled by economic frustrations, Nepal's interim prime minister, Sushila Karki, has appointed her initial cabinet. The appointments aim to stabilize the nation and address demands for clean governance as Karki prepares to lead the country towards elections in March.

title: Left out of Asia Cup squad! Siraj grabs spotlight with new achievement; speaks out
content: India's Mohammed Siraj has been named ICC Player of the Month for August 2023 after his match-winning performance against England, helping India level the series. Ireland's Orla Prendergast also received the award for her outstanding performance in a T20I series against Pakistan and the ICC Women's T20 World Cup Europe Qualifier.

title: ‘Bullying’: China slams Trump call for tariffs on Russia oil importers
content: China has strongly condemned the US proposal for G7 and NATO nations to impose tariffs on Chinese imports of Russian oil, labeling it as "unilateral bullying" and "economic coercion." Beijing warned of retaliatory measures if countries comply with Washington's request.

title: 'I only regret she didn’t die in front of me': Gwalior murderer’s chilling confession
content: Arvind Parihar fatally shot his wife, Nandini Kewat, outside a stadium in Gwalior, showing no remorse and expressing relief from their constant arguments. The murder followed a complaint Nandini filed against him and his anger over a birthday video she posted with another man. Parihar, already married with children, accused Nandini of infidelity and financial exploitation before the deadly act.

title: Tribals in Odisha tiger reserve allege they are being ‘fraudulently’ relocated
content: The Union Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change has ordered a probe into allegations that consent was ‘fraudulently’ obtained

title: SWR’s ‘Operation Meri Saheli’ reaches over 2 lakh solo women travellers in 2025
content: Launched in November 2020 by Indian Railways, the initiative focuses on providing assistance from the time of boarding until the completion of the journey

title: Madras High Court grants interim bail to Devanathan Yadav in Mylapore Hindu Permanent Fund case
content: Justice G. Jayachandran directs petitioner to mobilise ₹100 crore on his own and deposit it with the special court for TANPID cases in Chennai

title: Army launches rescue operations in flood-hit villages of Maharashtra
content: According to the Indian Army, responding to a request from the District Collector, Beed, the Indian Army launched Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) operations to rescue stranded residents.

title: Andhra Pradesh grapples with U.S. shrimp tariff, threatening aquaculture sector
content: The state continues to make strides in agriculture, industry, infrastructure, energy, tourism, and welfare, say officials

title: KPCC meeting outwardly muted over Mamkootathil’s attendance in Assembly
content: There appears to be a consensus among top leaders that the Congress MLA’s “surprise attendance” in the Assembly had helped the ruling front in directing the day’s news cycle away from issues plaguing the government.

title: Surging merchandise exports, falling imports cut India’s August trade deficit by half
content: India’s total exports increased to $69.2 billion in August 2025, up 9.3% over its level in August last year

title: Pressure politics builds up in Bihar before seat-sharing in INDIA and NDA camps
content: With the Assembly elections around the corner, parties in both the ruling and Opposing camps are making announcements on candidates and the number of seats they wish to contest, making allies and rivals uneasy

title: INS Nistar makes maiden port call at Singapore for multinational submarine rescue exercise
content: Commissioned on July 18, 2025, the INS Nistar is a testament to India’s growing self-reliance in shipbuilding, having achieved over 80% indigenisation

title: Collective condemn proposed Wildlife Amendment Bill
content: Bill represents political misrepresentation, ecological irresponsibility and statutory bypassing of expert authority, says ‘Coexistence Collective, Kerala’

title: Heartline programme to be launched for Kalyana Karnataka region tomorrow
content: It is aimed at reducing STEMI deaths, a sensitive form of cardiac arrest, while KKRDB will provide 32 advanced ambulances for the scheme

title: Andhra Pradesh achieved 10.80% GSDP growth rate due to collective efforts, says Finance Minister
content: Payyavula Keshav urges officials to sustain this momentum by focusing on planning, welfare, and meeting people’s needs. Revenue and Health Ministers outline steps to prevent land irregularities, ensure proper industrial land use, and expand health insurance coverage

title: NH-2 in Manipur not to reopen till agreement is reached with Meitei people: Kuki-Zo Council
content: The Council rescinds the pact it had signed with the MHA on September 4 for the re-opening of the highway and warns against violation of buffer zones. A senior government official says the KZC is playing with words to confuse the people

title: Centre criticised for allowing India to play Asia Cup cricket match with Pakistan
content: The Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister asks whether the match was important, though Pahalgam terror victims opposed it

title: BJP warns government of serious consequences if internal reservation matrix is not set right within deadline
content: The BJP has warned the Congress government of “serious consequences” if it ignores the one-week deadline served by Scheduled Castes activists to set right the “anomalies” with respect to internal reservation matrix

title: Kerala’s higher education sector poised for global recognition: R. Bindu
content: Higher Education Minister commends top-performing colleges and universities for their NAAC grades, and NIRF and KIRF rankings.

title: SDPI welcomes SC ruling on Waqf, but says order does not fully safeguard rights of Muslim community
content: State president of SDPI Abdul Majeed has said the party welcomes the court’s directions to protect Waqf properties from arbitrary dispossession and to stay the five-year professing Islam clause

title: It is important for all of us to protect and preserve democracy, says MLA
content: The district administration, zilla panchayat and the Department of Social Welfare organise International Day of Democracy in Belagavi

title: Artist Namboothiri’s original drawings handed over to Culture department
content: Artist Namboothiri’s works will initially be exhibited at the Kerala Lalithakala Akademi art galleries across the State.

title: Change needed in Kerala politics for Kerala Police to change: Shobha Surendran
content: She inaugurates a protest march led by BJP Thrissur city district committee to Assistant Commissioner’s office, demanding an end to police brutality

title: Ultrarunner from Thumba aims to make his mark at the world stage
content: Geeno Antony is the only male athlete from Kerala to be selected to represent the country at the IAU 24-hour World Championships to be held at Albi in France in October

title: Take up more research in soil fertility, CM tells farm scientists
content: During Krishi Mela at UAS in Dharwad, Siddaramaiah expresses concern over diminishing soil fertility across the nation

title: Women’s empowerment an economic necessity, says Lok Sabha Speaker
content: National conference in Tirupati adopts Tirupati Resolution, calling for investment in women’s health, education, skills, entrepreneurship, and digital inclusion to unlock their potential

title: Kerala HC acquits former Minister A. Neelalohitadasan Nadar in case pertaining to outraging modesty of woman officer
content: Court says there is no satisfactory explanation for the delay of more than two years in preferring the complaint and registering the FIR. It also says that since her version in court does not match her police statement, she cannot be considered a ‘sterling witness’ whose testimony can be accepted without corroboration

title: Muslim bodies call waqf decision ‘victory’ of Constitution’s spirit
content: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board said that though some of the major contentions of the petitioners have been accepted “to a large extent”, the board will continue with its ‘Save Waqf’ campaign

title: Abhimanyu carries wooden replica of howdah with ease
content: The exercise took place along the Dasara procession route with the entire Dasara elephant squad participating

title: Strive to achieve A.P.’s 15% growth rate target, Naidu tells Collectors
content: They should not be complacent in their duties, give due priority to field visits to get a feel of the problems faced by the people and take decisions not merely from the administrative perspective but with a humane touch, says Chief Minister

title: Mysore varsity V-C to lead delegation to British universities
content: The university is participating in the Karnataka Leadership Development Programme, a flagship initiative jointly launched by the British Council, U.K., and the State govt.’s Karnataka State Higher Education Council

title: New SP prioritises women safety, fight against ganja in Chittoor
content: Strengthening community policing will bridge the gap between people and the police and will build public trust, says Tushar Dudi

title: Applications open for Vadapalani Andavar temple’s Odhuvar training course
content: Application forms can be collected at the temple office or found on the temple and HR and CE websites; the deadline for submission is October 13

title: ‘SVZP to be made a centre for conservation, education and research’
content: Mallikharjun Rao, who is an advisor to Andhra Pradesh government, assesses living conditions, healthcare facilities, dietary management and general upkeep of the animals during an inspection of the park

title: PM to launch ‘Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar Abhiyaan’, and eighth ‘Poshan Maah’
content: The Union Health Ministry, and the Ministry of Women and Child Development join hands to lead India’s largest-ever initiative for women and child health

title: India is keen to preserve its relations with the U.S. but not at any cost: Tirumurti
content: “While it is true that President Trump has disrupted the trajectory of India-U.S. relations, I doubt that the U.S. tariffs nudged us closer to China in any substantive way,” Mr. Tirumurti says

title: Carter's Kiss To Trump's Step Ahead: Presidential Gaffes Toward UK Royals
content: Maybe it was nerves from being in the presence of royalty or perhaps it was a simple mistake, but there have been quite a few gaffes by US presidents and first ladies toward members of the British royal family over the years.

title: AAP Attacks BJP Over BMW Crash In Delhi, It Hits Back
content: The death of a finance ministry official after his motorcycle was rammed by a BMW in Delhi has also become a political flashpoint, with the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and the BJP trading charges over emergency care.

title: Pleas Against Invite To Banu Mushtaq for Mysuru Dasara Dismissed
content: The Karnataka High Court dismissed petitions challenging the state government's decision to invite Booker Prize-winning author Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate the Mysuru Dasara.

title: Mumbai Police Records Raj Kundra's Statement In Rs 60-Crore Cheating Case
content: Mumbai police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) on Monday recorded the statement of Bollywood actor Shilpa Shetty's husband and businessman Raj Kundra in connection with a Rs 60-crore cheating case, officials said.

title: Kim Seong-Min, Whose Broadcasts Relayed Foreign News To North Korea, Dies
content: Kim Seong-Min, a prominent North Korean defector who used radio broadcasts, USB sticks and a network of sources in the secretive country to inform the North Korean public about the truth of their authoritarian government, has died.

title: UK Defence Academy To Bar Israelis Over Gaza War
content: A prestigious UK government-run defence studies institute will not accept Israeli post-graduates from September 2026 over the Gaza war, the defence ministry said.

title: US Says Deal Has Been Reached On TikTok, But Details Are Sparse
content: A framework deal has been reached for the ownership of popular social video platform TikTok, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said after weekend trade talks between the US and China in Spain.

title: Qatar Hosts Summit After Israeli Strike In Doha, Seeks To Restrain Such Attacks
content: Qatar hosted a summit of leaders of Arab and Islamic nations in the hopes of presenting a united response to Israel's attack on Hamas leaders in Doha last week.

title: Minutes Before Cremation, 'Dead' Woman Found Alive In Odisha
content: A 86-year-old woman, who was presumed dead, was found alive on Monday moments before her last rites were to be performed at a crematorium in the pilgrim town of Puri.

title: 'Our Last Exchange Was...': Thadou Intellectual's Farewell To Leader Killed By Kuki Insurgents In Assam
content: Leaders of Thadou tribe in Assam wrapped the coffin of their community leader, Nehkam Jomhao, with the traditional Thadou Saipikhup shawl in what they called a mark of highest respect and honour to the 59-year-old who was killed by Kuki insurgents.

title: DNA Found Near Scene Of Charlie Kirk's Shooting Matches Suspect
content: DNA on a towel wrapped around a rifle found near where conservative activist Charlie Kirk was assassinated matched that of the 22-year-old accused in the killing, FBI Director Kash Patel said.

title: Puja Khedkar's Father Kidnapped Truck Helper To Pay For Damage To Rs 2-Crore SUV: Cops
content: Dilip Khedkar, father of sacked IAS officer Puja Khedkar, and his bodyguard had kidnapped the truck driver rescued from their home in Pune because their luxury SUV had collided with the truck and they wanted him to compensate for the damage.

title: Row After Union Minister Stopped From Entering VVIP Zone During PM's Kolkata Visit
content: Union Minister of State for Education Sukanta Majumdar was on Monday denied entry into the VVIP zone of the Kolkata airport while attempting to bid farewell to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: What We Know About Couple In BMW Which Rammed Finance Ministry Official
content: The couple in the BMW lives in Gurugram, police said, adding that they own a business of making horse leather saddles, seats, covers, and belts.

title: Video: After Accident, Accused Driver Pulled Out Of Overturned BMW
content: In another video of the aftermath of the crash in which a finance ministry official was killed in Delhi, passersby can be seen pulling out the woman who was behind the wheel of the BMW which caused the accident.

title: 9-Hour Trek To 36-Minute Ride: Adani Enterprises Gets Kedarnath Ropeway Project Contract
content: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led group's flagship firm has won a contract to build a nearly 13-km-long ropeway project connecting Sonprayag with Kedarnath, the company said on Monday.

title: Makhana Sales Up In Bihar, But Life Yet To Improve For Farmers
content: Makhana or fox nuts -- the labour-intensive superfood for which Bihar is the world capital -- has firmly placed itself in the food map, especially with the Central boost in the Union budget.

title: Delhi To Deploy 75 Drones With PM Modi's Image On His Birthday
content: The Delhi government will deploy 75 special drones featuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi's photograph at Tyagraj Stadium as part of his birthday celebration, an official said on Monday.

title: Mumbai Woman, 3 Aides Charged For Cheating Husband Of Rs 1.73 Crore
content: A woman allegedly cheated her husband of Rs 1.73 crore with the help of her three aides, on the pretext of getting him a loan and threatening to file a false police case against him in the eastern suburbs here, an official said on Monday.

title: Tesla's Stock Rises As Elon Musk Buys Over 2.5 Million Shares Worth $1 Billion
content: Tesla's stock is climbing as CEO Elon Musk disclosed the purchase of more than 2.5 million shares worth approximately $1 billion.

title: NWSL: Jaedyn Shaw has supercharged Gotham FC
content: our writers studied the action from across Matchday 20 to come up with this week's order of all 14 teams in the league . the first team to hit the 50-point mark in 2025, the Kansas City Current climbed to that total on the back of a scoreless draw with the Washington Spirit .

title: 'Khada ho!': Nitish pushes crowd to give standing ovation; watch PM's reaction
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Virginia Tech fires Brent Pry: Top candidates, transfers and recruits to watch
content: the Virginia Tech Hokies fired coach Brent Pry after a 0-3 start to the season . Pry was supposed to represent a return to the Frank Beamer glory years in blacksburg . but a bowl game in 2023 and a faceplant to start this season closed the curtain for Pry .

title: Fantasy baseball news: Rookies to enter playoff chase for Toronto and San Francisco
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the first day of the two-week championship round in ESPN head-to-head leagues features nine evening affairs, getting underway at 6:40 p.m. ET .

title: College football betting: Can the Irish still win the national championship?
content: Notre Dame has stumbled out of the gate, but the bigger question is whether those stumbles are cracks in the foundation or simply early growing pains against top-tier competition . what comes next will decide if this season fades into disappointment or transforms into something entirely different .

title: Top players discuss playoff format, cheat meals, hype-up music
content: the NHL is close to being back in action for the 2025-26 season . a new collective bargaining agreement has been signed between the league and the players . "cheat meals," pregame pump-up tunes and weird equipment quirks are among the favorites .

title: Why Brentford's goal vs. Chelsea wasn't ruled out for offside; Maddison's VAR rage
content: Steve Nicol defends Mohamed Salah from criticisms of his overall play . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the premier league . we take a look at the major incidents in terms of VAR protocol and the Laws of the Game .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the WNBA playoffs are finally here . the first round is a 1-1-1 format, with the higher seed hosting Game 1 and Game 3 . if necessary, the finals will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) format .

title: DeShaun Foster is out at UCLA; here's who could take over the Bruins
content: alum deShaun Foster was elevated late in the 2023-24 coaching carousel . the school fired Foster after an 0-3 start in which the Bruins were outscored 108-43 . he is a former assistant and standout running back in the NFL .

title: Fighters' grades: Did Crawford or Inoue have the better weekend?
content: three of ESPN's top 10 pound-for-pound fighters were in action this weekend . no. 3 Terence Crawford clashed with no. 8 canelo alvarez at Allegiant Stadium . Naoya Inoue put his undisputed junior featherweight titles on the line against murodjon Akhmadaliev .

title: 'Enmity with Punjab?’: CM Mann raps Centre’s flood relief; compares it with Afghan aid
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world . read more ankita mallick’s amazing pictures Karishma Tanna wraps winter in charm 10 unique baby girl names beginning with letter B Bigg Boss Malayalam fame Sobha Viswanath’s top traditional picks 8 interesting

title: Takeaways from every game: Eagles defeat Chiefs in Super Bowl rematch
content: the Packers beat the Commanders in the first overtime game of the season . the Patriots eclipsed 30 points for the first time since 2021 in their tight win over the Dolphins . in the early window Sunday, the Bills and Ravens dominated the Jets and Browns after their head-to-head thriller last Sunday .

title: 🏈 College Football Power Rankings after Week 3
content: college football's breakout stars are on display in the 2025 college football landscape . big Ten powers Ohio State, Penn State and Oregon all took care of business with help from their early standouts in Week 3 . the big Ten giants leaned on their new starting quarterbacks in an overtime classic .

title: 'More wins': Mayfield hungry in Year 3 with the Bucs
content: field Yates explains why he's dropping Baker Mayfield to QB15 in fantasy for week 2 . he was the leading rusher for both teams by the game's end . Mayfield went 3-for-10 on passes of 15 or more air yards in the first quarter .

title: What has gone wrong for the Mets? Breaking down their second-half woes
content: the new york Mets beat the Milwaukee Brewers 5-2 in the wild-card series . a 3-run walk-off homer in the 10th inning was the biggest for the Mets in their past nine games . it wasn't the biggest hit of Pete Alonso's career, but his homer was certainly the biggest .

title: C.J. Stroud learning how to balance life and faith with being face of the Texans
content: Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud was coming off a season in which he admitted that the fun was missing at times in football . he focused mainly on football, family and his faith . the approach was clear: stay out of the spotlight as much as possible .
